glsa.title: FreeType: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in FreeType might allow remote attacker(s) to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: FreeType is a high-quality and portable font engine.

description.p: A flaw in FreeTypeâ€™s handling of embedded PNG bitmaps was discovered where the image height and width was not checked to be within bounds.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted font file using FreeType possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All FreeType users should upgrade to the latest version:
